channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report I-2023060105
item.description:
Report I-2023060105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-06
  • City: Kansas City
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HOLLAND INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: One box was punctured by the forklift. The release was properly managed. The damaged freight was placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023060762
item.description:
Report X-2023060762

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A METAL BUCKET WITH SHIPPING PAPERS AND A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABEL WAS FOUND IN AN UNLOAD TRAILOR THAT HAD BEEN DENTED AT THE LID AND HAD LEAKED SLIGHTLY. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER PLACED THE BUCKET IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED IT TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

Report X-2023060761

  • City: LAWRENCE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, SUPERVISOR SAW NO AUDIT FORM SO INVESTIGATED TO FIND HAZMAT LEAKING. RESPONDER PROCESSED MATERIALS THROUGH DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023060692
item.description:
Report X-2023060692

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS PICKED UP OFF OUTBOUND IRREG TABLE, LOADER NOTICED THAT PACKAGE HAD SOLID MATERIAL SPILLING OUT OF THE CORNER. LOADER PLACED THE PACKAGE DOWN, STEPPED AWAY FROM THE AREA AND CONTACTED DESIGNATED RESPONDER. OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CONTACTED DUE TO THE PACKAGE BEING 1.4 EXPLOSIVE. OUTSIDE RESPONDER DISCOVERED THAT THE INTERNAL PACKAGING HAD A MISSING CAP.

item.title: Report X-2023060691
item.description:
Report X-2023060691

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SUPERVISOR DISCOVERED PACKAGE LEAKING IN DOOR AND RADIO DMP FOR A RESPONDER. RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED WITH FULL PPE AND FULL SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND USED THE DECISION TREE TO DETERMINE THE APPROIATE STEPS TO FOLLOW. RESPONDER FOLLOWED STEPS AS HE WAS TRAINED TOO APPROIATLY CLEAN UP THE SPILL. SPILL WAS CLEANED UP AND THE PACKAGE AND MATERIALS WERE BROUGHT BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023060602
item.description:
Report X-2023060602

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a package handler was loading a trailer, he noticed that a hazmat package was leaking, and he told to his manager. DescribePack: One gallon got loose cap and spilled out about 6 ounces. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA went to the area with a red tote line with a hazmat bag and some loose absorb, we clean the area and brought the package to the processing cage.

Report X-2023060400

  • City: LENEXA

item.title: Report E-2023060281
item.description:
Report E-2023060281

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-18
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 5 gallon cans of isopropyl alcohol (un1219) releasing 5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023060575
item.description:
Report X-2023060575

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-31
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHEN THE MANAGER OPENED THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS DAMAGED AND CALLED QA OVER. QA BROUGHT A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG AND LOOSE ABSORB. THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LOADED IMPROPERLY AND LEAKED OUT. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE LOOSE ABSORB. ONCE IT WAS CLEANED AND SAFE TO UNLOAD AGAIN, QA BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: TWO OF THE LIDS WERE FOUND OFF OF THE CANS AND THE CONTENTS LEAKED OUT. ALSO DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE HAD A HAZMAT FLAMMABLE LABEL ON THE OUTSIDE, BUT THE LABEL ITSELF WAS A PPD LABEL AND NOT A HAZMAT SHIPPING LABEL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG. THE CONTENTS WERE CLEANED UP WITH SOME LOOSE ABSORB.

item.title: Report X-2023060569
item.description:
Report X-2023060569

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-31
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While QA was doing a dock walk, we found a leaking package in a tote. DescribePack: When I open the package, I noticed that one can got punctured and all the content s spilled out. I also noticed that the shipper doesn't send this as limited quantity. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: QA brought the package to the processing cage in a toe lime with a hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2023060520
item.description:
Report X-2023060520

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-31
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023060520 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER NOTIFIED THE MANAGER OF THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND THE MANAGER NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE CONTAINER WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAP AND SOILED THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. 2. X-2023060528 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND NOTIFIED THE MANAGER THE MANAGER THEN NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. AFTER THE SPILL WAS CLEAN THE PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE CONTAINER WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAP AND SOILED THE PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023060518
item.description:
Report X-2023060518

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-29
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE BAG HAD A LOOSE CAP AND LEAKED OUT SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023060301
item.description:
Report X-2023060301

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE QA WAS DOING THEIR DOCK WALK, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING UNDERNEATH THE IC BELT. QA QUICKLY GRABBED A RED TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND PLACED IT IN THE TOTE. QA BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PAIL IS DENTED IN NEAR THE TOP OF THE CAN CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE TOP. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A RED TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report X-2023060201
item.description:
Report X-2023060201

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-20
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While QA was working in our area, we found a wet pacakge. We open the pacakge and discovered that the contents were hazmat but the outside pacakge have no arrows no labels nothing. DescribePack: Because the package has no inner packing the container were lose and one got crushed and loose cap spilling out some of the contents. DurationRel: 15 and MitigateEffect: QA put the pacakge in a red tote line with a hazmat bag and put it in the processing cage.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the spill was cleaned with absorb-all and neutralizer, the leaker was placed in a tote with a liner then brought to QA.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 4 of the 4 liter cans of camp fuel (un1268) had been crushed by the rest of the load and had released 2 liters of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release so no contractors were dispatched.

RESPONDER ARRIVED IN FULL PPE AND FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND ALL APPORIATE TRAINING. AFTER CLEANUP THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023051299
item.description:

item.title: Report X-2023051226
item.description:
Report X-2023051226

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-21
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE QA DID A DOCK WALK, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET/LEAKING IN A TOTE. THEY QUICKLY GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAPS. DurationRel: 15 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG AND BROUGHT BACK TO QA FOR INSPECTION.

item.title: Report E-2023050452
item.description:
Report E-2023050452

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN3149 Oximycin P5 release from a 5-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor due to the vented cap leaking as a result of the pail falling in transit. Absorbents and neutralizer were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All cleanup debris was collected into a vented 55-gallon poly drum. The jugs were re-stacked and secured to a pallet for shipment on. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE FOR THE CORRECT WAY TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. TOOK THE DAMAGED PACKAGE BACK TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOAL. PACKAGE WAS THEN DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING DMP METHODS.
